Education Archive
2023 MiND Spring Theater Intensive
2023 MiND Winter Theater Intensive
Miami Beach Regional Library’s Auditorium 227 22nd St, Miami Beach, FL 33139 Full Scholarship Applications were due Saturday, December 10th, but Partial Scholarships are still available for applicants.
2022 MiND Summer Theater Intensive
JUN-JUL 2022 - MiND’s SUMMER THEATER INTENSIVE offers new opportunities to develop your skills as a young actor, playwright, and all around theater artist!
The Courage (To Right a Woman’s Wrongs)
TOURING APRIL 5 - 30. A Spanish Golden Age comedy by Ana Caro de Mallén y Soto and directed by Peter Romano. Learn more.
Past Connections
MARCH 22, 2022 - For 9 weeks, Coral Park Senior High students have been taking part in MiND's In-School Theater Residency. Past Connections is a new original play developed through artistic research triggered by the desire to grow from within. Read more.
Playwriting Workshop
SEPT-OCT 2021 - A virtual workshop meant to stimulate the creative process, learn the basic principles of playwriting, and use theatre as a tool for activism and advocacy. Learn more.
Summer Theatre Intensives
JULY 2021 - Our inaugural summer programming highlighted performance training and script composition, as well as enhancing our students’ skills as multifaceted storytellers. Learn more.
In-School Theatre Workshops
MAR - JUNE 2021 - We launched our first training program for young artists. Our virtual partnership included two schools: Coral Park Senior High, and Miami Beach Senior High. Learn more.
In-School STEAM Classes
Our inaugural STEAM (STEM + the Arts) classes kicked off in Spring of 2021. We partnered with Miami Beach Senior High School to reach approximately 50 students over the course of 26 classes. Our primary focus was using these virtual classes led by 12 professional…
The Caucasian Chalk Circle
FEB 2020 - This free touring production was performed exclusively for Miami-Dade Public School students and at community spaces (African Heritage Cultural Arts Center & Opa-Locka Community Development). Served 5200 students from 22 schools with 27 performances.
Antigone in the World
FEB 2019 - Antigone in the World, a production of Sophocles’ tragedy performed by a young, international, and ethnically diverse company of actors in unconventional theater spaces. The play was performed in over a dozen Miami-Dade County public high schools.
ABOUT
Miami New Drama is a not-for-profit 501(c)3 presenting and producing organization. We are committed to theatrical excellence and theater-making as a means of social engagement, cultural conversation and human interaction.
Learn more about us.
